notes.text:
Red Hat AMQ Broker 7.12.0 is now available from the Red Hat Customer Portal.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
AMQ Broker is a high-performance messaging implementation based on ActiveMQ Artemis. It uses an asynchronous journal for fast message persistence, and supports multiple languages, protocols, and platforms.

This release of Red Hat AMQ Broker 7.12.0 includes security and bug fixes, and enhancements. For further information, refer to the release notes linked to in the References section.

Security Fix(es):

* (CVE-2023-34455) snappy-java: Unchecked chunk length leads to DoS
* (CVE-2023-35116) jackson-databind: denial of service via cylic dependencies

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat products and services.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat AMQ Broker 7.12.0 release and security update

cwe.name: Improper Validation of Specified Index, Position, or Offset in Input

notes.text: A flaw was found in Snappy-java's fileSnappyInputStream hasNextChunk function, which does not sufficiently evaluate input bytes before beginning operations. This issue could allow an attacker to send malicious input to trigger an out of memory error that crashes the program, resulting in a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: snappy-java: Unchecked chunk length leads to DoS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).

vulnerabilities.title: snappy-java: Unchecked chunk length leads to DoS

cwe.name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling

notes.text: jackson-databind through 2.15.2 allows attackers to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact via a crafted object that uses cyclic dependencies. NOTE: the vendor's perspective is that this is not a valid vulnerability report, because the steps of constructing a cyclic data structure and trying to serialize it cannot be achieved by an external attacker.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jackson-databind: denial of service via cylic dependencies
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This CVE is disputed by the component developers and is under reconsideration by NIST. As such, it should be excluded from scanning utilities or other compliance systems until the dispute is finalized.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).
jackson-databind should not be used to deserialize untrusted inputs. User inputs should be validated and sanitized before processing.

vulnerabilities.title: jackson-databind: denial of service via cylic dependencies
